website_summaries.verdict: Make it through the frustrating assembly process, and you’ll have a stable, strong stand that folds easily for storage and will last for years.
pros: Once assembled, this stand is very sturdy and easy to roll around
Lowering or raising it takes little effort thanks to its hydraulic assist
cons: Feed support for wood cutting isn’t quite up to snuff
Stand doesn’t rise high enough for some users
Assembly can be a bit problematic – instructions are complicated

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it closed!
customer_reviews.text: This Dewalt miter saw stand definitely has a problem. I cannot get the stand to go to the closed position after it has been in the full open position. It hangs up in the midway position and will not move from there. I cannot get it to close. There is something not right with the control cable and springs and cams. I don't know what is wrong but I know it won't close. One time when I was trying to get it to work, it closed suddenly and almost caught my hand. I believe the open/close controls are poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: It REALLY does NOT fold
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have read more reviews. After I purchased it from Amazon, I completed my assembly and then experienced a problem that as it turns out is VERY common. The cable system that assists with the raising and lowering is junk. Mine is now stuck like other people’s and it will not fold which TOTALLY negates it’s value...I am going to call Dewalt on Monday but if they can’t help me I will need to find someway to ship it back to Amazon and of course the box is 40% destroyed... Do NOT buy this system
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cooley

customer_reviews.title: Shipping and Product very Poor
customer_reviews.text: Box dropped and package pretty much destroyed. Opened up and discovered no hardware to assemble, no instructions. Tried to put together best I could. Table up all the way and will not go down. Checked cable linkage to no avail, will not go down. Really disappointed with purchase. Wished I had bought locally, paid a little more but wouldn’t have all the hassle to get things right.
customer_reviews.author: Philo

customer_reviews.title: Defective product two in a row
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of the rolling miter saw stands over the years. I purchased a new one this week.It would not retract so I had to dismantle and send back. The second one came also defective. The horizontal locking mechanism does not engage so the bars slide out without engaging. Both sides defective. When I try to tighten horizontal lock knobs to stop bars from sliding they do not tighten nor can I remove them both stripped. Second defective item and I really do not want to send it back again as it is very difficult and time consuming. As I said I have 5 of these stands so I know how they work. Very disappointing. John.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A Highly Recommended Addition for Your Miter Saw.
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading from a standard to sliding compound saw, I bought the DeWalt stand to go with it. This is one heavy duty and stable stand. I didn’t have any problems with the latch experienced by some of the other reviewers. But if I would have, the mechanism is so simple I could have figured out the adjustments easily. This stand is highly recommended if you bought a sliding compound saw. It make is easier to move if you have to. The only con I can see would be loading the mounted saw/stand in a pickup. Unless you are very strong, two people will be needed to safely load the saw.
customer_reviews.author: D. Graf

customer_reviews.title: Almost liked this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked the thing at the job site, assembled it, raised it up and mounted the saw on it. Used it for 3 days and it worked well. Ready to load it back into my truck and it would not fold up again. Supposed to be 3 positions to it but could only get one position. Worked nearly 30 minutes trying to find a way to fold it but to no avail. Had to remove the saw and dismantle the stand to get it back in the truck. Pneumatic cylinder is frozen and won't move no matter what I do. Thinking I will box it up and send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Rich C.

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to raise and lower
customer_reviews.text: Update: Tricky to figure out. Highly suggest cutting the 2 white safety straps off then take the y-shaped plastic cover off the middle sliding support beam and practice raising and lowering the stand to see how the cable actuated (via the red lever) release mechanisms work. Do this before you attach your saw. To lower the stand, you need to lift up an inch or two using the black handle to allow the metal catches to disengage and then guide the saw down (depressing the red lever the whole time obviously).
customer_reviews.author: WHP3

customer_reviews.title: Will not close!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this stand a few times now and when it works it's really great. I'm a die-hard Dewalt guy so when I was researching stand, I thought I would stick to what works but now I think I might have made my first bad choice in a Dewalt product. The opening and closing mechanism seriously needs redesigning. It takes me forever to close my stand and I have to watch my hands because I can see me getting my hands pinched. Everything else about this stand is great. Too bad at a missed opportunity from Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C.

customer_reviews.title: The unit is sturdy enough but it will not collapse
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as described. The unit is sturdy enough but it will not collapse. The release cable is too long and not mounted correctly. The spring tensioner doesn't work at all. The cable can not be cut so I will remove the spring and hard wire it to the release, hopefully solving the problem. The rest of the unit seems OK and very sturdy but it does not collapse and that is the main reason I bought the stand.
customer_reviews.author: James O Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, smart stand
customer_reviews.text: Overall, loving this stand. I do have questions about the reliability of the assisted lifting mechanism (the strut). Generally, the more complicated something is the higher chance it will fail somewhere down the road. So far it has been great, so time will tell. The material support arms are decent but they seem to lack the rigidity of other models. They seem to sag a bit as you extend them out and put weight on the ends. The assisted lifting is nice but not super smooth, it requires some getting use to. By far my favorite feature is the stand's ability to 'stand' vertically WITH the miter saw mounted, allowing you to store it neatly away.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent construction - missing tool
customer_reviews.text: This table is a very well made, quality product. I had a sliding miter saw to attach to it and wanted as much portability as possible, this basically goes from hand-truck to work-site table. One critic I do have is that the instructions say to "use the included tool" to tighten screws, but NO tool was included. Be aware that there is some assembly, but the critical parts are already assembled, so you basically attach the handle, the lower leg, and the wheels. Dewalt generally is a reliable product, but looks like someone slipped up either in not including the tool, or leaving in the instructions that one is provided.
customer_reviews.author: S. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice stand for your miter saw. Just be careful of your fingers when you lift and lower it.
customer_reviews.author: RetireNavy

customer_reviews.title: Best stand available!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a BEAST! Extremely easy to use/adjust. Makes moving my 50lb miter saw a snap. Tried a couple other stands that were either a pain to move, a pain to setup, or both! The added height adjustability was a bonus. And all the pieces fit and adjust smoothly. Had a delta stand that required a hammer to adjust parts on it. Very happy with this purchase. Oh, and packing was top notch. Everything bagged, secured, and foam protected properly. Only con would be that the manual doesn’t include any assembly instructions, just a few pictures. Though if you’re handy enough to need this, you’d figure it out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Shareef Yousef

customer_reviews.title: How stupid of me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 8 months ago. How stupid of me, I should of bought it years ago. I love this thing. This thing is really heavy duty, it will stand the test of time. Easy to asse3mble, to use, to fold, unfold. This is the real deal. Go get one now!!!!! Pricy yes but we3ll worth it. I bought a cheap model first and wasted whatever I paid for it. I didn't want to spend a couple hundred on one of these. SPEND IT, YOU WILL BE GLAD YOU DID.
customer_reviews.author: Apostlepaul

customer_reviews.title: Super Awesome.  6/5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: This stand is amazing. It’s easy to put together, the construction is of superior quality, and the saw mounted easily once I got it all out together. The stand has two heights when it’s set up for cutting mode. Shorter people will appreciate that feature. My only knock on the stand would be when you have it in storage mode, standing straight up, you will needs to use a strap to ensure it doesn’t tip over during transport. Other than that I highly, highly, recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jameson Kersey

customer_reviews.title: Zero problems getting it to function.
customer_reviews.text: It is much heavier than I thought it would be but that's a small complaint compared to how easy I can move my 12 inch mitre saw around now. No problems at all getting my stand to collapse and expand (maybe I got a Tuesday model instead of Friday). I should clarify, it moves around pretty easy as well as long as you collapse the stand before trying to move it.
customer_reviews.author: B Braseth

customer_reviews.title: Great Work Bench for My Shop
customer_reviews.text: This makes a great, mobile work bench. What really works great for me is that it has 3 height positions and you can go from one position to another in seconds. It worked so good for my saw that I bought another one for my bench top drill press. I need to work from the lower heights and this fits me great. You can also roll it out of the way when not using if nothing bolted down you could fold it and store against the wall.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE H.

customer_reviews.title: Ordered product, the release cable needed to be adjusted ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered product, the release cable needed to be adjusted, had to send it to De Walt for repair. Wheels could be larger for easier movement over terrain.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t finish assembling as the screw thread was missing on the leg assembly.
customer_reviews.text: In what is a great product, sturdy etc the factory did not tap the screw thread to assemble the legs. Given that these hold the thing up it’s a big deal. Shame as its a 5 star product otherwise. Contacted Dewalt and they sent a new leg. Same exact problem but worse. Three of the 4 screw holes were without threads. I guess I 'll invest in a tap and die set to compensate for their mistakes. Update * Works fine now I fixed the screw-thread problem. A little on the heavy side and its not so easy to lift up and down but it makes storage easy,
customer_reviews.author: Spa Girl

customer_reviews.title: Latch System Failure
customer_reviews.text: This stand is a great idea...and when it worked, it was just “okay”, at best. The latching mechanism that allows the stand to be shut has failed completely. The only way to get this to work is to have another set of hands there to actuate the release system latch pins and get this stand to collapse. This has been a complete waste of time and effort for our company and I’d like to figure out how to get my money back. This was an expensive investment and buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: I really love this cart
customer_reviews.text: I really love this cart. I use it with my 12" miter saw for work in the garage. The top setting is a perfect work height for me. I like that I can collapse it and load it into my Explorer without taking the saw off. In between projects it fits perfectly on my garage shelf (with the saw on another. The extension arms that have adjustable heights make it easy to cut a 8' board down in my garage, and then quickly readjust for working with shorter pieces.
customer_reviews.author: bjjjcr

customer_reviews.title: Good quality; easy up & down
customer_reviews.text: This table is perfect! I can wheel out my chop saw to anywhere I want. It has extenders that slide back into the table. When I'm done it collapses down and rolls away into half the space of my rickety old table. Assembly is fairly easy. It was done by guesswork for the most part because the "instructions" consist mostly of numbered pics with unreadable numbers. But it's not hard to figure out. The materials are good quality; my saw fits perfectly. I'm a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Auntie J

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but missing parts...
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and quality of what I actually received. The box was undamaged, so nothing fell out of the box. But, there were two missing parts from the kit: (1) a tightening knob (2) a shield piece for one end of the unit. Due to winter weather, I waited too long to get the issue resolved, so I'm disappointed in the overall transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Pour Boy

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to set and use
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set-up. I typically use the red tools with the name that rhymes with Milwaukee. I received a DeWalt 12" compound slider as a pass-along minus the clamp-on stand. After removing the clamp mount brackets from the saw, it secures very easily to this new stand. This sets up for use quickly and allows my aged self to move the saw via the hand-truck mode, saving me valuable Advil uses for moving 6x6 posts onto the saw rather than for moving the saw. We'll see if the components stand the test of time, but for now it looks like a solid set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: saw mounts good. only problem is extendable arm supports that holds ...
customer_reviews.text: saw mounts good. only problem is extendable arm supports that holds the long board don't stick out far enough forward for wide boards. works good board narrow boards like 2x4's. other than that it works great. I am not sending it back but would look for something else if buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor quality and design
customer_reviews.text: i can't stress enough how poorly made this stand is. bolt holes misaligned, cheap soft metal, inadequate piston (it was harder to lift the stand with the saw on it then it is to just pick up my saw!). used it once - went up OK, but wouldn't go down...so much for collapsible and portable. the release jammed because the metal is crap. save you money, buy another brand or just get a folding stand for half the price. cheers
customer_reviews.author: rlw

customer_reviews.title: keep looking
customer_reviews.text: do you like puzzles? how about putting things together with out the supplied tool? do you like re taping bolt holes? then this is the saw stand for you. you will be able to tell your friends of the effort it took to figure out the how's and whys of this piece of equipment, don't get me wrong the table seems great it just would of been nice with some instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Dewalt DWS779 compound miter saw and decided to purchase the stand for portability. Very happy I did. It works great with different height adjustments and mounting rails that can be installed for large boards etc. It is easy to assemble and rolls with the heavy saw on it easily. I keep the saw mounted on the stand and it doesn't take up much space. Plus can fold down for storing under work bench etc. Definitely worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Straight answers!

customer_reviews.title: PORTABLE AND FOLDS UP FOR EASY STORAGE
customer_reviews.text: Glad I don't have my saw taking up all of that space in my garage. This stand works great. It is a bit heavy , but that just makes it sturdy. No wobble at all. Folds up and out of the way ! The only down side was, no work space. So I cut a 3/4 inch piece of ply wood and mounted it to the stand, and then mounted the DEWALT SLIDING MITER SAW to the plywood. Problem solved. DEWALT makes a great product. Glad I spent the bucks.
customer_reviews.author: CAMPFIRESKY

customer_reviews.title: What a bear this has been. Greasly.
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to use the saw since purchasing because the bench will not open or close on command. The stand came with some parts put together and some not. The parts that were put together by dewalt were not secured. After I put it all together and mounted the saw I could not raise it. The latch would not operate correctly. So I have taken the saw off and I am troubleshooting the situation. Everybody wants me to send it back but that has turned out to be a nightmare. So I am going try more fix it ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Donald C.

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I have to do a lot of projects for family, and carrying around my 12" extending DeWalt miter saw is super heavy and awkward. Wife got me this for my birthday, and its super easy to fold up and roll away to next job. I was going to buy the saw horse version of this with extension arms, but this is literally that with wheels. Solid build quality, and takes a beating. Downside would be the extension arms are pretty short. I wish they were mildly staggered so they could get the entire unit in length, going from 6ish foot max extension to 10-12 foot.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn E.

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the lift release.
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived on time and in good condition. The assembly instructions were worthless. There wasn't that much assembly required and looking at the assembled picture was adequate. After assembly and raising to the upper position, the release mechanism would not work to lower. Customer service said to return to a repair facility. I had to disasemble the lift to lower for shipping and found the problem from factory assembly. After fixing this, and proper adjustment, the stand works very well and as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Old  Hhicckory

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!  You will LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this stand! We are the standard DYI so space is limited. Projects were such a hassle having to set up a table, pull out the saw, get things set up. Then when done, put all the things up. This makes things SOOO much easier and takes much less space! Now those small projects we put off are done because it is a quick matter of rolling the saw out, popping it up, plugging it in and BAM! You are ready to go! Only regret is that this wasn't available years ago!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Great addition and worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised by the weight...The dewalt instructions are a joke....there's no directions...the diagrams are horrible, but after visualizing it for a few I put it together...Overall it's a great addition and much needed. The stationary stand is heavier..My only beef is the bolts used to attach the saw to the stand...Dewalt needs to devise a guicker system to attach and remove the saw...Worth it overall...especially at the price...
customer_reviews.author: john r.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stand with a few minor issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stand. There are a few issues: 1. Mine arrived with stripped, improperly tapped, or paint filled threads. I had to use a metric thread tap to clear/re-tap the threads before assembly. 2. It is heavy. With a saw mounted you are hauling well over 100 lbs. This can be a lot to lift into a vehicle or take up and down stairs. Otherwise, this thing is great!
customer_reviews.author: F. Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Not portable
customer_reviews.text: This stand kinda stinks cuz you cant use the quick attach for it. It's a waste of money. Why would you want to unbolt saw everytime you put it in your truck. It's great if you only have it in shop or a job trailer. Its Built heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Judyann Fridgen

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, but with some issues.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to maneuver Heavy duty Small storage footprint (vertical storage can be a tipping hazard) Cons: Heavy Latches get stuck at top position and will not fold into the storage position without fixing Support bars at lowest setting, are still higher than my miter saw (DWS779) base. Cannot lock into highest position due to latches getting stuck
customer_reviews.author: Raihan M. Ali

customer_reviews.title: POS...Another piece of garbage out of China that will end up in the local transfer station.
customer_reviews.text: What a horribly made product right out of the box! Followed the instructions to a "T" and this is what I found; only one extension arm can be stored within the unit, it pushes the other one straight out. This doesn't allow the unit to completely close and storage of the unit is now an issue. The table only extends to the intermediate level, about 15" off the floor and it will not extend to the highest level. After removing everything from the box and packaging there's no way this will get repackaged to get sent back...off to the transfer station I go!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Defective Work Support Arms
customer_reviews.text: While assembling the stand I discovered the attachment knobs for the work support arms will not tighten down due to defective welds. I've attempted to resolve this issue with DeWalt Support with no clear resolution as yet, I will have to return this item to Amazon if Dewalt fails to send me the correct replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Good Stand
customer_reviews.text: Assembled easy enough but one of the pre-threaded holes needed to be chased out with a tap! But other than that it was a breeze to put together! Heavier than expected and the spring works well to lift the table if you follow the instructions and put your foot on the bottom of the stand and lift up while releasing the latch! All in all I'm satisfied with the unit
customer_reviews.author: Rocsurfer

customer_reviews.title: Quality control needs work
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a few days but based on the condition when unboxing I'm not hopeful. There were two major quality issues when assembling, see the attached pictures. First, one of the slots for the rails was bent so badly it will never move. Fortunately it was already in the position I needed it. Second, one of the telescoping arms was bent so badly on the end that it would not sure slot in until I filed it down. I needed the stand and could not wait for a replacement so I made it work but it speaks very poorly of Dewalts quality control these days.
customer_reviews.author: B.Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Easier to Use my 12" Miter Saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold a 12" miter saw. Assembly was fairly straight-forward. There are three different "Types" of this stand -- looks like Dewalt has been changing the extension tubes. I did not encounter any problems raising or lowering the saw like other customers mentioned. It does seem easier to lower the saw if you pull up on when releasing the lock pin.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for DIY Guy
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews before purchasing this item. True, the extension arms aren't the strongest, or longest, so there is sway when handling longer lumber. However, the product is great for all the work I have. Just finished a 12x12 shed and using the stand to hold the sliding compound miter saw worked perfectly. Also used this setup for cutting the cedar and support boards for the new fence. I have had no problem in raising or lowering the stand. Folded up, the stand is easily rolled to its storage location. The only problem I had was during assembly where they shortcut a few instructions but it is easy enough to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: JBT

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice combo to the 779 saw. I don't like the end stops since they can bend a little and if you are trying to do fine repetition work that is a no-no. Roller stands would be nice but I made some. Legs on the extensions would be better for stability so I made some and an extra long rail extension with work top that makes life easier. It is nice and stable with good latches. Like it a WHOLE lot better with wheels than the ones that don't have them. It is plenty solid to leave the saw attached for vertical storage as well.
customer_reviews.author: George Gest

customer_reviews.title: works with any number of saws & makes transport a breeze! vertical storage with saw attached!
customer_reviews.text: bought this when I purchased my DeWalt 12in Miter saw to help with transporting it. Whether you are going from job to job or just rolling it out of your basement you'll be pleased with this purchase! In addition , it stores vertically with the saw attached so it saves space in your shop and is completely set up to work as soon as you raise it into position.1
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a must have. Easy to assemble. I’ve had no issues at all with folding it up and down. One of the board support extensions was a little stiff early on, but has since gotten smoother. I’ve been wheeling this thing around the last couple weeks nonstop and I love it. I’m using it with the DeWalt 779 12” miter and it stows perfectly in my garage next to some shelving that’s about 24” from the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: So happy I bought this stand to go along with my ...
customer_reviews.text: So happy I bought this stand to go along with my DW 717. This stand is very rigid and sturdy. the setup was fairly easy. There is some assembly required of the wheels and handle, but the instructions are pretty straightforward. It folds up and allows me to store my saw out of the way when not in use. Very happy with this stand. I would absolutely recommend getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Saves room in the garage
customer_reviews.text: This makes it a lot easier to store and use my miter saw. A similar stand came with my table saw so I tracked this down. There are cheaper stands, but I doubt they're as well made as this one. And, I couldn't see paying more for something that looked identical, but had a different brand name on it. Prices vary, so that may not be exactly the case when you read this, but it'd be hard to beat this one.
customer_reviews.author: NLS

customer_reviews.title: DON’T WAIT - BUY IT NOW FOR YOUR MITER SAW
customer_reviews.text: I looked at these for probably 2 years from different manufactures and when I saw this one with wheels I finally said this is the one I have been waiting on. You will not regret this purchase for your Dewalt Miter saw. Set up took about 45 minutes to have it ready to cut with. Very mobile and easy to move around in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P

customer_reviews.title: Great but instructions may lead you to reset saw
customer_reviews.text: Went together in about 15 minutes. Only issue was when mounting the miter saw per directions, it is actually backwards (lumber supports barely would support a 2x6). This thing is tall when folded up! I am pumped overall as I no longer need to work off the ground with stacked 2x’s to support the boards when cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: Should be better for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not as nice as the Rigid saw cart it replaced that cost half the price. Release mechanism very hard to activate even after doing YouTube cable lube fix. After using for a month, it is starting to loosen up finally. From an ergonomic perspective, this cart is very hard on your back when opening and closing.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Smithee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't happy when I had to spend this much money on a stand but it's been a life saver. It enables me to move the saw around without hubby's help. I am especially thrilled with the supports on both sides for whatever you are cutting. Makes cutting things like 16ft crown molding a breeze and can be done easily alone.
customer_reviews.author: TamiP

customer_reviews.title: Great construction, but overbuilt
customer_reviews.text: Great construction, but overbuilt. The thing is unnecessarily heavy, and with the Dewalt miter saw mounted on top it's quite difficult to raise it up from its collapsed position. Because of the weight portability is somewhat limited. The release mechanism does not operate easily. The extension arms are great.
customer_reviews.author: richard elrauch

customer_reviews.title: Instructions not very clear
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dewalt miter saw, and it works great. Assembly is fairly easy, but the instructions are not very clear. The instructions don't give you a detailed step by step way to assemble it, but I figured it out. My saw for fits perfectly. To lift the stand, you need to use a little muscle, which is a good thing because you don't want it to go up too quickly. It's very easy to roll around and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Cary

customer_reviews.title: Worked great folding twice and doesn't fold anymore
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice cart for my DeWalt saw. The collapsing mechanism worked twice and now doesn't work at all. Disappointing. Because I bought the cart so it could collapse and I could easily stow my saw with less space. I am on the fence of recommending. I was going to buy the Dealt contractor table saw complementary cart, but now I am holding off. Not what I expected from DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Norton

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand, very portable.
customer_reviews.text: The stand works pretty good. If I had any criticisms it would be that they tell you not to stand it up for storage...well, that is exactly why I wanted a foldable stand. However, I do store my saw upright and it seems to work fine. It also takes quite a bit of effort to raise. Generally, I am happy and plan on using my new saw (& stand) for many years.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wisner

customer_reviews.title: Good stand
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad stand... good for my needs. I am not a contractor and don't move my saw all over the place. I do have a fairly small shop in the basement, however, and it's nice to be able to move this around when cutting longer boards or just storing it in the corner. Every so often I do bring the saw outside to do window trim etc... and it's nice for that as well. Just wish it were a bit taller. I like my saw up high and the top height on this is a little low for my taste.
customer_reviews.author: Russell B. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Beware of paint job
customer_reviews.text: It came in the condition of the photos. Paint job is not that great. Out of box you can see areas that the paint chipped off. When screwing in bolt paint cracked and chipped off. Equipment itself takes a bit to figure out how to fold and unfold. Once you get pass learning curve operation is straight forward. Be careful to check its locked before raise to transport. Can open and tip over when miter saw is attached because it’s top heavy! So beware! Overall it functions quite well! Only disappointment was the paint job is poor quality or perhaps I just got a bad one!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie A Romano

customer_reviews.title: He rolls it outside his shop to cut so the sawdust isn't all over the place plus he can easily move it closer to where ever he i
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his birthday. He didn't seem really too excited about it, I could just tell, but he changed his tune after putting our drop arm saw on this. He rolls it outside his shop to cut so the sawdust isn't all over the place plus he can easily move it closer to where ever he is using it. Now for most boards, I don't have to drop what I am doing to come hold the ends while he cuts!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not receive the one that is pictured
customer_reviews.text: The miter saw stand that I received was the correct model number listed but it was not the same one that is pictured. When I received does not have the cord wrapped in the back and it does not have the rollers on the extensions it just has the stops. This would have been the second one I have purchased and I was hoping for this one to be exactly the same as the other one that I have but it is not. The first photo shows that the cord wrapped that is pictured is missing. The second photo shows that the extension arm does not have the roller it just has the flat stop.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole1

customer_reviews.title: I love my DeWalt machine stands,
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these to keep both saws mounted and to be able to store them vertically. I am blown away by the beefy steady structure they provide. The wheels are real rubber and not plastic. The frame is well made, painted a beautiful DeWalt yellow, and looks great in my garage. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wrong Way Bill

customer_reviews.title: STRONG, STURDY, BUT HEAVY TO LIFT!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Strong, sturdy, well made quality product as typical from Dewalt, and no problem installing my Dewalt compound miter saw. Much easier to move saw now than when it was mounted on Dewalt metal saw horse. But this mobile stand is heavy if you're going to be picking it up to haul in a truck, for example!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Mobility
customer_reviews.text: I received a couple of hours ago, got it ALL put together and it will not raise. The line that pulls the patch is too long and therefore will not release latch. I contacted DeWalt and was told I needed to return it and get a new they also stated this is not a common problem but many other reviews state the same problem with raising or lowering. Very frustrating that I now have to take it all back apart and return. I will not be placing. I will choose a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: A T

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble table and install miter saw
customer_reviews.text: This stand turned an awkward transport/storage of miter saw into an easy transport and storage of saw. Had a little trouble learning to raise and lower the stand. The trick was to hold table latch release all the way over and then lift the table. Once the table latch clears, you can release the lever.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Mostly happy, just not with the sliding end supports
customer_reviews.text: Great stand and easy to maneuver. My only complaint is I not at all happy with the two sliding end rods used to extend the table. They should be removeable! Once you put them in, you can’t get them back out and one end pushes the other out. They slide back and forth, but get in the way when storing the unit. Makes it bigger than it needs to be when storing it! Had I know that you couldn’t get them back out, I never would have put them in!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: I SHOULD HAVE BOUGHT THIS YEARS AGO!
customer_reviews.text: It is almost surprising how much more productive you are when you dont have to lug your tools around by hand and set them up on saw-horses in a fixed location. Working on exterior and interior trim, being able to setup anywhere in seconds and quickly re-locate was much more beneficial than I had anticipated. The added space savings of upright storage has been wonderful in my limited shop. Good quality and easy to put together. Note: This says that it could also hold a portable planer (such as the DW735) however after mounting mine on top of it as a test, it would be WAY too unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great stand ... update: not any more, it won't close now
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, but heavy means heavy duty! Very pleased with this purchase. Works great with our 12" dual bevel compound miter saw. As some have mentioned no it does not have rollers on the extension holders. And yes the extension bars are centered so even though they are 12" wide you only get use out of 6 inches for holding long boards. Meh still worth it a great stand! update*** Wont close just like everyone says. bummer. cool idea but buy a different brand. my dad got a Rigid one at home depot and does not have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: stable stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand was not easy to put together. Instruction were very poor. Once together its worked well but it takes getting use to. The up and down part. It is stable but heavy. But it needs to be to handle the saw. Overall after using it for several weeks, Great additional to my shop.
customer_reviews.author: horsehide

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my tools
customer_reviews.text: I am now able to leave the saw on the stand. It folds up easily so I can roll it into a corner of the garage. Had to remove the saw everytime I used the saw with the old stand in order to store it. I can now take the saw easily to any project I have around my home. This rolling stand was the same price as my stationary stand.
customer_reviews.author: RLC

customer_reviews.title: Not like they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I guess DEWALT is trying to save money by eliminating features on this saw stand. Primarily the extenders that you rely on to hold whatever your cutting have had the rollers eliminated. This was a nice feature, gave you move flexibility as a professional. As a novice you'll never notice.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W. Braun

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected which is great!
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY reason I’m giving 4 stars is because only my boyfriend can move it with the saw on! I’m not strong enough! But that’s to be expected with a heavy saw mounted to it! Otherwise it’s perfect! The saw fits nice and it’s very sturdy! My boyfriend loves it! Easy to store and easy to get it out of the shop!!
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: The linkage to open and close the stand is too long and won’t open or close the saw properly. The stand is sturdy but the hassle of opening and closing is off putting. If I had gotten it from the store I would have returned it. With the price I expect it to work well out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: The Shipman

customer_reviews.title: A must have for a good miter saw.  HEAVY but stable for sawing and easy to move
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and an absolute necessity for a chop saw. Love it, very sturdy, but HEAVY. Wheels make it easy to move around. Stabile when using without any other help, due to weight of stand and saw it is very stable. I used roller stands for the ends of 20' boards and 16' 4x4 posts, etc. and the saw and stand never moved a bit. Buy it if you have the miter saw to match it, you will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H

customer_reviews.title: Best miter saw stand on the market
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this years ago. Just did a ship lap wall with 12 ‘ boards and this made it so simple. Mounted my miter saw and when it’s folded it is a major space saver. I love this product. Be sure and read the instructions on raising and lowering.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Flawed
customer_reviews.text: As a basic stand, the unit is OK. I haven't had any problems finding and unfolding. The problem is the extension wings, which are basically useless. The supports flex under weight, and the stop piece also flexes no matter how much you tighten it. This makes it impossible to use the stop for precise repeated cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Greene

customer_reviews.title: It is heavy and good quality, but needs space to move around
customer_reviews.text: Very solid stand. You will need sufficient space to move around. It is very heavy with the saw, and will not very easy to go up and down on steps. But in very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Countryboy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the 779 and it worked out perfectly. Real nice combination that allows you to easily roll the saw around. Don't think you're lifting this and throwing it in the back of your truck easily though. The combination is very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. Stuck in the upright position just 6 weeks after starting to use. Unable to return because missed window by a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great stand and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband but I think I use it just as much. It is a great table and easy to setup. I love that it has wheels. It makes it so easy to move our saw around. I am able to use it on my own and don’t have to wait for my husband to move the saw for me anymore. I get a lot more craft projects done. My husband is very satisfied with the stand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY DIFFICULT TO RAISE AND COLLAPSE BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: The stand is extremely difficult to raise and lower even with the shock assist the handle that you’re supposed to use broke on the first try very soft bolt extremely disappointed for what I paid if you’re going to be continually moving around do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for dewalt compound miter saw
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for dewalt compound miter saw. Miter saw bolts to the stand so it is secure and won’t fall off. Wood extension slides have round bars not rollers which is the only downside for the stand. Hydraulic assist makes it easy to put to a good working height and the stand locks in place so it won’t collapse while in use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T

customer_reviews.title: Great stand!!
customer_reviews.text: Great price on this stand. Really heavy duty, I was standing on this thing numerous times while in my truck and it barely flexes. Adjustable for many brands of saws, im using it with a dewalt. Very easy to move around with nice neverflat tires. My only complaint was the directions for assembly were really over complicated and I questioned why I even read them!
customer_reviews.author: plumber

customer_reviews.title: Quality dewalt product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad who’s 70 and was carrying his miter saw around whenever he needed to cut something. Assembled it for him as well. Overall good quality as would be expected from dewalt. The folding mechanism is a little tricky but after a few uses you’ll get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Seda

customer_reviews.title: This really will come in handy this spring.
customer_reviews.text: Boy, I don't what I would do without this. I of course, have put my new Dewalt miter saw, on this.... I kinda struggle to move it out of the garage, by myself (as the saw is so heavy). But because of this rolling stand I will be moving it all over this summer. I am 63 year old woman, and I love my tools. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Newer, cheaper model.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this. This is the second one I have bought and it was made cheaper than the first. The supports on this one have solid tubing instead of rollers with bearings. This one does not have anywhere to wrap your cord like the first one I bought. I paid just as much, but got a lesser product. Not real happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: K. H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect space saver
customer_reviews.text: This stand is great for a small garage or work space. very stable when its deployed and fits nicely up against the wall with my 12" dewalt sliding miter saw. You need to adjust the cables at setup but other than that it works great. very adjustable for any saw
customer_reviews.author: Kim P.

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great miter saw stand. I had a regular miter saw stand from harbor freight with legs and wheels that was too hard too move and took up too much space. This stand was just what I needed. It is very easy to move in and out my shop. I can now move it outside my shop where I don’t get saw dust all over everything. I wish I had purchased this stand when I bought my miter saw.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Rod

customer_reviews.title: Sold as new.  Arrived obviously repacked and damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a mangled box with much retaping. Upon opening...first appeared OK. Styrofoam packaging was broken. Assembly was easy. Extension stays - there are two. At first looked OK. But...one is supposed to telescope into the other - both were identical. So have to either return entirely (and this means repackage, etc.) or order replacement part for 15 dollars. Settled for replacement part - have to get from DeWalt. Typically am very satisfied with Amazon. Best they examine items before sending - definitely now "new". Will meet my needs however.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Selva

customer_reviews.title: Necessary accessory for saw
customer_reviews.text: Bought at the same time with saw. Easy to mount saw. Whole unit is still bulky when folded up, but makes unit portable which is why I bought it. Very stable. Would buy again, but this thing should last me forever.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Foutch

customer_reviews.title: It won’t fold down
customer_reviews.text: I like having the saw on the stand but right out of the box it would not fold down. I just figured this model didn’t have that feature. It wasn’t until today that my brother-in-law looked it up and said it should be able to fold down. This is very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

customer_reviews.title: miter saw stand
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect stand with the wheels on it. it is very easy to roll around and is sturdy. Was easy to assemble and my harbor freight 12 inch miter saw fits it perfectly. Everything works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well, but the latch release is stiff and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well, but the latch release is stiff and doesn't always catch, and the hydraulic assist is rough. I have to yank up to make it latch at full height, then I have to yank up to make it release.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Check the parts
customer_reviews.text: I just received this stand, opened it up and there were no wheels, tees to support the wood you're cutting, or directions. Very frustrating to wait so long and get something I had to return. I can't wait for a new one so I'll go to home depot and got one today.
customer_reviews.author: adirondackjack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for DeWalt miter saws, and heavy duty...
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly heavy duty. I mounted a DeWalt DWS780 miter saw to this, and there's no other way to go. The stand comes 90% assembled and the hardware screws and bolts seem to be made of better steel than the usual chinese garbage. The tubing is heavy duty, the wheels are nice, it operates up and down very nice, so overall this is a very nice stand, and versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Pushrod

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in good condition. I've had it for about 3 months using it at my home shop. Monday was the first time I transported it to a job site and had no problems with it. So far I'm loving it.
customer_reviews.author: John Shockley

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, easy to assemble. Handles heavy chop saw with ease.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Mounted a new DeWalt chop saw on this stand. Easy to assemble and looks like it would work for many brands and types of saw. Dislike: Lift handle is offset to one side of center and has a strange mount bracket... like the designers had the latch placed and then realized "oops, we need to put a lift handle on this end" ...... should be a "D" handle with two stout mounting bolts. Runoff stand needs rollers for working material to slide across.... very cheap plastic material support. Stand otherwise excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Butcher

customer_reviews.title: Makes moving and setting up my saw and work area a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: Assembled took me about 30 minutes. Once I got it together and mounted my saw, I was surprised how easily it handles the weight and folds into the upright working position. Moving the saw around my basement and outdoors is a snap now, making me mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Jam35Gr3g0ry

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant with so so reviews. Very happy I bought it. I am a professional contractor, I use my saw daily, this is so much better than the old dewalt clamping system on their stand. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good miter saw stand
customer_reviews.text: Good miter saw stand, but the only drawback for me is how much a pain it is to remove the saw. Its a $100 cheaper than the Bosh Gravity stand but the quick disconnect might be worth the difference. Once the saw is bolted on your not going to casually remove it for something minor. Stand is otherwise a good product.
customer_reviews.author: frosty

customer_reviews.title: Great solid stand but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand. The box arrived a bit beat up and the straps were very loose. I’m surprised nothing fell out the box during delivery. This stand is rock solid but heavy. Easy to assemble. The only thing I don’t like That once it was assembled I couldn’t get it to collapse. For a hour and half struggling looking online why. But found out and Fixed it. The Miter saw and the Stand together are heavy but I can’t wait to try it out. Better stand than my old Kobalt stand. Still get five stars but Dewalt needs to fix that collapsible problem.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin H.

product_meta.title: DEWALT DWX726 Miter Saw Stand With Wheels, Yellow
product_meta.description:
View largerView largerDURABLE WORK SUPPORT STAND
DEWALT’s DWX726 Rolling Miter Saw/Planer Stand allows for easy jobsite mobility thanks to its wide rubber wheels and fold-up design. The DWX726 is designed for a variety of contractors including cabinetmakers, trim carpenters, framers, installers and many other professionals who are tasked with using a miter saw on the jobsite.

 With three-position pneumatically assisted raising and lowering, the DWX726 is easy to assemble to minimize downtime. The unit is also durable with a tubular steel construction that allows for 300 pounds of maximum weight capacity. The mounting rails are easily adjustable, and they can adapt to nearly any miter saw on the market. Additionally, the stand offers wide adjustable infeed and outfeed work supports, which provide up to 8 feet of material support. Weighing a manageable 67 pounds, the stand is 98 inches long and 32.5 inches wide when it is unfolded. To save space, the unit folds vertically and measures only 59.5 inches by 17 inches. Miter saw not included.


KEY SPECIFICATIONS
 * Tool Width - Extended: 98 inches 
 * Tool Height - Extended: 32.5 inches 
 * Tool Width - Folded: 59.5 inches 
 * Tool Height - Folded: 17 inches 
 * Tool Weight: 67 pounds 
 * Shipping Weight: 75 pounds 

ABOUT DEWALT
DEWALT is a leading manufacturer of industrial power tools and accessories, including corded and cordless drills, saws, hammers, grinders, routers, planers, plate joiners, sanders, lasers, generators, compressors, nailers, saw blades, metal and masonry drill bits, abrasives, screw driving accessories and more. DEWALT tools can be found nationally and internationally, wherever tools are sold. With more than 1,000 factory-owned and authorized locations, DEWALT has one of the most extensive service and repair networks in North America.
feature_bullets: Dimensions: Extended Tool - 32.5" H x 98" W | Folded Tool - 17" H x 59.5" W | Weight: 67 lb
Wide adjustable infeed and outfeed work supports provide up to 8' of material support
Easily adjustable mounting rails adapt to nearly any miter saw
Wide rubber grip wheels provide easy jobsite mobility
Three-position pneumatic assisted raising and lowering for the ultimate in flexibility and ease of set up
Durable tubular steel construction allows for a 300-Pound maximum weight capacity

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,840 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
